a.span: APS COVID-19 FACT SHEET - Updated regularly
View the Remote Learning Resources Website
View Superintendent Munn’s Message on Remote Learning

div.h4: APS to Continue Remote Learning through End of School Year

a.strong: 3/23: Remote Learning in APS Begins March 31
Available Mental Health Supports for Students, Families and Staff
Resources for Schools and Families During COVID-19

strong.a: Comic to Teach Children about COVID-19
CDC Preventing COVID-19 Spread in Communities

a.strong: How to Stop the Spread of Germs from CDC
Read all APS Messages and Information Related to COVID-19

div.p: In times of crisis, we know that a sense of stability is the best thing for our kids. Over the last several weeks, we have all worked together to create a new sense of stability through our remote learning platform. While we continue to refine our work, we have heard from many of you that this platform is providing your students with a renewed sense of connection to our educational community.

On Tuesday, Governor Jared Polis issued an executive order extending the suspension of in-person learning through April 30. As we shared with you earlier, superintendents across the Denver metro area then made the collective decision that all of our schools will remain closed to in-person learning for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. This means we will NOT be returning to schools for in-person learning through the end of this school year.

li.strong: Read the full message from Superintendent Munn.

div.h4: Important Message from APS and Denver Metro Superintendents
div.p: Please read the following message from superintendents across the Denver metro area. We will be following up with you this evening with more information that is specific to Aurora Public Schools. In the best interest of the communities we serve, many school districts in the Denver metro area, including Aurora Public Schools, have decided to remain closed to in-person learning for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.

li.strong: Read the full message from Denver Metro Superintendents.

div.h4: APS Offers FREE Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner to Students AND Adults During Extended Closure
div.p: During the extended school closure, Aurora Public Schools will be distributing FREE breakfast, lunch and dinner. These meals will be provided at 16 locations. All three meals, which include vegetarian options, will be available together for pickup through a grab-and-go system. Thanks to generous philanthropic support, we are now able to provide meals to everyone including adults. Also, the current stay-at-home order from the Tri-County Health Department does NOT affect our free meal program.

a.strong: Read all APS Messages and Information Related to COVID-19

a.span: Visit the APS Wellness Website for Families

hr.h4: APS School Based Health Clinics are OPEN! Call today for an appointment!
Please bookmark this page for latest updates and important resources related to COVID-19.

div.strong:

a.title: Powered by WordPress, state-of-the-art semantic personal publishing platform.

span.strong: STUDENT DATA PRIVACY AND SECURITY ACT

p.span: The Aurora Public School District holds data privacy and security in high regard and takes action to ensure that our students’ data is handled securely in compliance with the Colorado Student Data Transparency and Security Act (HB 16-1423) and the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA).

The Aurora Public Schools is committed to the policy that all persons shall have equal access to its programs, facilities, and employment and does not discriminate on the basis of race, age, color, creed, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, religion, ancestry, sex or need for special education services, and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups.

strong.span: Read the full Notice of Nondiscrimination.

p.span: Most documents on this site are saved in Adobe Acrobat format (PDF) or in Google Docs. Download the latest free version of Adobe Acrobat Reader to view PDF files.

span.em: RSS feeds courtesy of Feedwind and Feedburner.

p.span: It is the goal of Aurora Public Schools that the information on this website be accessible to individuals with visual, hearing or cognitive disabilities.

If you are unable to access any page(s) in our site, please email the Aurora Public Schools Information Technology Service Desk. Please include the location of the webpage/document and your name, email address and telephone number so that we may contact you to provide the information in another format.
Please note that some pages on the Aurora Public Schools website contain links to third-party sites. APS is not responsible for the content, facts, opinions or accessibility of third-party sites.
Formal grievances regarding Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and/or Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act maybe filed pursuant to Policy AC and Regulation AC-R found here.

strong.span: Read the full Notice of Web Accessibility.
